Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix force delete bug: handle string boolean parameters from MCP

Critical fix for force delete feature that was failing in production.

Root cause: MCP serializes boolean parameters as strings \("true"/"false"\),
but the remove_workflow_input tool was checking the raw value, causing
force=true to be treated as force=False.

Changes:
- src/backend/tools/workflow_input/remove.py: Added explicit string-to-bool
  conversion for force parameter to handle MCP''s JSON serialization
- src/backend/tests/test_workflow_inputs.py: Added test for string boolean
  parameter compatibility
- src/backend/tests/test_force_delete_integration.py: Added comprehensive
  integration tests with MCP disabled to verify full feature flow
- src/backend/agents/orchestrator.py: Fixed current_workflow sync from tool
  responses \(from previous session\)
- requirements.txt: Fixed uvicorn version conflict with mcp package

Tests:
- All force delete integration tests pass \(4/4\)
- String boolean parameter test passes
- Feature now works correctly in production with MCP

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
